meanings.definition: To cause slight but persistent annoyance, discomfort, or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The itchy tag on his shirt niggled him all day.
meanings.sent2: The dripping faucet niggled her to the point of calling a plumber.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel niggled the cat by stealing its treats.
meanings.sent4: The unanswered question niggled at the back of her mind like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy fabric niggled against his skin, making him squirm.

meanings.definition: To spend too much time on minor details.
meanings.sent1: She niggled over the font choice for hours.
meanings.sent2: He niggled with the formatting of the report instead of focusing on the content.
meanings.sent3: The perfectionist niggled endlessly over the placement of a comma.
meanings.sent4: Her mind niggled at the small errors, unable to let them go.
meanings.sent5: He niggled at the margins, trying to make them perfectly even.

meanings.definition: To argue or raise objections about a trivial matter.
meanings.sent1: They niggled about who should take out the trash.
meanings.sent2: She niggled with her brother over the TV remote.
meanings.sent3: The siblings niggled over whose turn it was to feed the fish.
meanings.sent4: The coworkers niggled over the temperature in the office.
meanings.sent5: He niggled with the waiter about the placement of the napkin.
